message.content:
cs.CR, cs.OS, cs.SE, cs.DC, cs.AR 

This paper discusses a security mechanism for trusted execution environments (TEEs) such as Intel SGX, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper specifically addresses the issue of privilege separation in TEE applications, which involves partitioning an enclave into tagged memory regions and enforcing per-region access rules, indicating a focus on operating systems (cs.OS) and software engineering (cs.SE). The use of Memory Protection Keys (MPK) for memory tagging suggests a potential connection to distributed computing (cs.DC) and architecture (cs.AR).
